summary: In this context, ethylbenzene and butadiene are both mentioned as components of BTEX (Benzene, Toluene, Ethylbenzene, and Xylene) in relation to polymer selection for uptake and release in a bioreactor system. However, there is no direct discussion of their specific interactions or relationships beyond their inclusion in the broader category of BTEX compounds. The focus is primarily on the polymers tested for their ability to interact with these compounds rather than on ethylbenzene and butadiene themselves.
